claim: The Eiffel Tower is located in Berlin, Germany.
label: REFUTES
evidence: The Eiffel Tower is a wrought-iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France.

claim: Albert Einstein received the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.
label: SUPPORTS
evidence: He received the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921 for his explanation of the photoelectric effect.

claim: The Great Wall of China was built entirely during the Qing Dynasty.
label: REFUTES
evidence: Several walls were built from as early as the 7th century BCE. The most well-known sections were built by the Ming Dynasty (1368â€“1644).

claim: Python was created by Guido van Rossum.
label: SUPPORTS
evidence: Python was conceived in the late 1980s by Guido van Rossum at Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica (CWI) in the Netherlands.

claim: The Amazon River is the smallest river in the world.
label: REFUTES
evidence: The Amazon River is the largest river by discharge volume of water in the world.

claim: The Moon orbits Earth at an average distance of 384,400 km.
label: SUPPORTS
evidence: It orbits at an average distance of 384,400 km (238,900 mi).

claim: DNA stands for deoxyribonucleic acid.
label: SUPPORTS
evidence: DNA, or deoxyribonucleic acid, is a molecule composed of two polynucleotide chains that coil around each other to form a double helix.

claim: Climate change is caused by natural cycles and not by human activities.
label: REFUTES
evidence: Human activities have been the main driver of climate change since the 1800s, primarily due to the burning of fossil fuels.

claim: The US Declaration of Independence was signed in 1776.
label: SUPPORTS
evidence: The United States Declaration of Independence was adopted by the Second Continental Congress on July 4, 1776.

claim: Water covers approximately 71% of the Earth's surface.
label: SUPPORTS
evidence: Water covers about 71% of the Earth's surface.

claim: The Sun is powered by chemical combustion reactions.
label: REFUTES
evidence: It is a nearly perfect ball of hot plasma, heated to incandescence by nuclear fusion reactions in its core.

claim: Shakespeare was born in London, England.
label: REFUTES
evidence: He was born in Stratford-upon-Avon in 1564.

claim: Photosynthesis converts light energy into chemical energy.
label: SUPPORTS
evidence: Photosynthesis is a process used by plants and other organisms to convert light energy into chemical energy.

claim: The human brain has approximately 86 billion neurons.
label: SUPPORTS
evidence: The human brain contains approximately 86 billion neurons.

claim: The speed of light is about 150,000 km/s.
label: REFUTES
evidence: The speed of light in vacuum is exactly 299,792,458 metres per second (approximately 300,000 km/s).

claim: The modern Olympic Games were first held in Paris in 1900.
label: REFUTES
evidence: The modern Olympics were revived in Athens in 1896 by Pierre de Coubertin.

claim: Isaac Newton formulated the law of universal gravitation.
label: SUPPORTS
evidence: Isaac Newton formulated the law of universal gravitation in 1687.

claim: The Pacific Ocean is smaller than the Atlantic Ocean.
label: REFUTES
evidence: The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest of Earth's five oceanic divisions.

claim: Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence.
label: SUPPORTS
evidence: Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that provides systems the ability to automatically learn and improve from experience.

claim: The Mona Lisa was painted by Michelangelo.
label: REFUTES
evidence: The Mona Lisa is a half-length portrait painting by Italian artist Leonardo da Vinci.
